poem:
"Silencing of the Quill"

In Delhi's heart, a voice now stilled, 
Evicted to retain the unsaid.
Correspondent Dias, freedom's quill,
Your tale in straitened ink is read.

On Modi's watch, the words grow meek,
Sly censorship in saffron's spread.
Journalism, strong yet strangely weak,
Made mute where truth and power dread.

In India's soul, a silence stirred,
A nation's truth, too difficult said.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Reporting in India ‘too difficult’ under Modi, says departing Australian journalist The south-Asia correspondent for Australia’s national broadcaster, Avani Dias, has been forced out of India after her reporting fell foul of the Indian government, in a sign of the increasing pressure on journalists in the country under Narendra Modi. Dias, who has been based in Delhi for the ABC since January 2022, said she felt the government had made it “too difficult” for her". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
